showMessages.label: Show Messages
showMessages.summary: Display warnings and errors in the Message Board
showMessages.description: The message board provides information about warnings and critical errors that have occurred during the current Maya session. They are indicated by the (1) number of the Ragdoll menu.

exportPhysics.label: Export Physics
exportPhysics.description: Export the internals of the Ragdoll solver into a new file, this file could then be imported back into Maya for re-application onto an identical character or imported elsewhere such as Unreal or Unity.

importPhysics.label: Import Physics
importPhysics.description: Import a previously exported Ragdoll scene from disk.

openPhysics.label: Open Physics
openPhysics.summary: Generate new Maya scene from .rag file
openPhysics.description: Be rid of all native Maya nodes and work with pure physics at optimal performance. Export and apply the baked keyframes onto your original, heavy character rig once finished tinkering.

applyPhysics.label: Apply Physics
applyPhysics.summary: Import, bake and delete physics from disk.
applyPhysics.description: Eliminate any and all interactions with physics by immediately baking the provided file on import, and deleting physics afterwards. This can be useful for quickly applying physics to tails and such without requiring much up-front control. Or for automating physics altogeher on a farm.

replaceMesh.label: Replace Mesh
replaceMesh.summary: Replace input of the 'Mesh' shape type with another polygonal or NURBS mesh.
replaceMesh.description: Substitute the current input of the 'Mesh' shape type with another. Also taking worldspace into account, so the mesh can be anywhere in the scene, under any group or voodoo magic.

editConstraintFrames.label: Edit Constraint Pivots
editConstraintFrames.summary: Edit the parent and child pivots using native Maya transforms
editConstraintFrames.description: Create editable transforms for the parent and child pivots for the selected constraint, or constraint under the selected transform. The parent frame represents the position and orientation the child rigid is connected, and vice versa.

resetConstraintFrames.label: Reset Constraint Frames
resetConstraintFrames.summary: Reset constraint frames to their defaults
resetConstraintFrames.description: Set the frames of a constraint such that twist rotates a rigid along its length.

deleteAllPhysics.label: Delete Physics
deleteAllPhysics.summary: Clear the Maya scene of anything related to Ragdoll.
deleteAllPhysics.description: Clear the Maya scene of anything related to Ragdoll. This can be useful for getting a clean slate, or to debug whether the problem you are experiencing is related to Ragdoll.

explorer.label: Ragdoll Explorer
explorer.summary: Explore the internals of the solver.
explorer.description: Ragdoll Explorer is a user interface for contents coming out of cmds.ragdollDump(). That is, the solver internals used for export to another application.

globalPreferences.label: Ragdoll Preferences
globalPreferences.summary: Edit global Ragdoll preferences, like the scale at which Ragdoll draws things.
globalPreferences.description: Edit the scale of manipulators and visual elements of Ragdoll, especially constriants. If you work at a scale other than Maya's currently set units, this command is your friend.

savePreferences.label: Save Preferences
savePreferences.description: Ragdoll preferences are stored alongside Maya's preferences. So clearing those would also clear Ragdoll's preferences.

resetPreferences.label: Reset Preferences
resetPreferences.summary: Restore Ragdoll preferences to their default values.
resetPreferences.description: This doesn't save preferences, something to keep in mind.

ragdoll.summary: View your version, and eventually look for updates and tutorials. Not yet though.

assignMarker.label: Assign
assignMarker.description: Add a unique marker to the selected node, such that Ragdoll can find and simulate it.

assignGroup.label: Assign and Connect
assignGroup.summary: Assign marker to this group of nodes
assignGroup.description: Add a series of markers to the selected nodes, such that Ragdoll can find and simulate the hierarchy it creates.

assignHierarchy.label: Assign to Hierarchy
assignHierarchy.summary: Assign marker to this group of nodes
assignHierarchy.description: Add a series of markers to the selected nodes, such that Ragdoll can find and simulate the hierarchy it creates.

assignEnvironment.label: Assign Environment
assignEnvironment.summary: Assign environment to this polygonal mesh.
assignEnvironment.description: Import this polygonal mesh as-is, without any post-processing, to collide against each individual polygon (more precisely, against each triangle).

assignPlan.label: Assign Plan
assignPlan.summary: Assign a plan to selected body and feet.
assignPlan.description: Create a new plan for the selected body and 1 or more feet, the plan will drive the translate and rotate channels.

assignTerrain.label: Assign Terrain
assignTerrain.summary: Assign a terrain to selected plan.
assignTerrain.description: Use the selected polygon mesh as terrain for the plan.

addTarget.label: Add Target
addTarget.summary: Add another target to selected plan.
addTarget.description: Add new target to the plan.

updatePlan.label: Update Plan
updatePlan.summary: Recompute locomotion for all or selected plans.

recordLocomotion.label: Record Locomotion
recordLocomotion.description: This calls on Maya's native Record Results command to store your locomotion on a new Animation Layer.

deleteLocomotion.label: Delete Locomotion
deleteLocomotion.summary: Delete all locomotion from the Maya scene.

resetFoot.label: Reset Foot
resetFoot.summary: Reset the reference position of the selected foot or feet.
resetFoot.description: The reference position will be reset to wherever the feet are located at the time of running this command.

groupMarkers.label: Group
groupMarkers.description: Create a new group containing the currently selected markers. The group carries settings that affect all members within that group, such as Stiffness and Damping.

ungroupMarkers.label: Ungroup
ungroupMarkers.description: Remove markers from their group, making them standalone.

moveToGroup.label: Move to Group
moveToGroup.description: Move markers from whatever group they are currently in, if any, into the selected group.

mergeSolvers.label: Merge Solvers
mergeSolvers.summary: Merge two or more solvers into one.
mergeSolvers.description: Move the contents of two or more solvers into one shared solver, where they can interact with each other.

extractFromSolver.label: Extract Markers
extractFromSolver.description: Move markers *out* of one solver and into a new solver, where they can run in parallel with the original, without interacting with each other.

moveToSolver.label: Move to Solver
moveToSolver.description: Move markers from one solver into another, where they can interact with other markers in the destination solver.

assignConstraint.label: Assign Constraint
assignConstraint.description: Create a new constraint between the two selected markers.

distanceConstraint.label: Distance Constraint
distanceConstraint.summary: Constrain the distance between two markers
distanceConstraint.description: Create a new constraint between the two selected markers.

fixedConstraint.label: Weld Constraint
fixedConstraint.summary: Constrain the position and orientation between two markers
fixedConstraint.description: Create a new constraint between the two selected markers.

pinConstraint.label: Pin Constraint
pinConstraint.summary: Softly constrain the position and orientation of a marker in worldspace
pinConstraint.description: Create a new pin constraint between the selected marker and the world.

attachConstraint.label: Attach Constraint
attachConstraint.summary: Softly constrain the position and orientation of a marker relative another marker.
attachConstraint.description: Create a new attach constraint between two selected markers.

mimicConstraint.label: Mimic Constraint
mimicConstraint.summary: Generate a hierarchy of local soft pins
mimicConstraint.description: Create a new mimic starting at the selected marker.

recordMarkers.label: Record Simulation
recordMarkers.description: Record the simulation as animation onto the marker targets.

snapMarkers.label: Snap to Simulation
snapMarkers.description: Move animation to where the simulation is right now.

markersManipulator.label: Manipulator
markersManipulator.summary: Interactively edit the contents of a solver
markersManipulator.description: Toggle visibility of the various manipulators accessible to you, such that you can edit them interactively rather than via the Channel Box.

markersAutoLimit.label: Auto Limit
markersAutoLimit.summary: Automatically transfer locked rotate channels into Ragdoll limits
markersAutoLimit.description: Determine how to replicate the locked Maya channels in physics using the rotate limits of a marker.

extractMarkers.label: Extract Simulation
extractMarkers.description: Generate a joint hierarchy for each marker along with the baked simulation.

retargetMarker.label: Retarget Marker
retargetMarker.summary: Change where to record the selected marker
retargetMarker.description: When recording, this is where keyframes go. Typically this is from e.g. a joint to an animation control, but can also be from the same control that was assigned a marker.

reassignMarker.label: Reassign Marker
reassignMarker.summary: Change the input to the selected marker

reparentMarker.label: Reparent Marker
reparentMarker.summary: Change the parent of the selected marker

unparentMarker.label: Unparent Marker
unparentMarker.summary: Remove the parent from the selected marker

untargetMarker.label: Untarget Marker
untargetMarker.summary: Remove all output from the selected marker

resetShape.label: Reset Shape
resetShape.summary: Reset shape settings based on new conditions.
resetShape.description: This will recompute the selected shape, given any new position, scale or orientation of the source transform. Useful in case you accidentally break things or have made changes you'd like to refresh.

resetMarkerConstraintFrames.label: Reset Constraint Frames
resetMarkerConstraintFrames.summary: Reset constraint frames to their defaults
resetMarkerConstraintFrames.description: Set the frames of a constraint such that twist rotates a rigid along its length.

editMarkerConstraintFrames.label: Edit Constraint Frames
editMarkerConstraintFrames.description: Generate two locators to manipulate the parent and child frames of a Marker. This is an advanced topic, use at your own risk, and use Reset Constraint Frames if making a mistake.

toggleChannelBoxAttributes.label: Toggle Channel Box Attributes
toggleChannelBoxAttributes.summary: Expose (or unexpose) more attributes for your Markers
toggleChannelBoxAttributes.description: Make non-keyable attributes relevant to authoring of Markers visible in the Channel Box, such as Mass and Length.

markerReplaceMesh.label: Replace Mesh
markerReplaceMesh.summary: Replace input of the 'Mesh' shape type with another polygonal or NURBS mesh.
markerReplaceMesh.description: Substitute the current input of the 'Mesh' shape type with another. Also taking worldspace into account, so the mesh can be anywhere in the scene, under any group or voodoo magic.

parentMarker.label: Parent Marker
parentMarker.summary: Select the parent of this marker

childMarkers.label: Child Markers
childMarkers.summary: Select the children of this marker

selectMarkers.label: Select Markers
selectMarkers.summary: Select all markers in the scene.
selectMarkers.description: Select all markers in the scene.

selectGroups.label: Select Groups
selectGroups.summary: Select all groups in the scene.
selectGroups.description: Select all groups in the scene.

selectGroupMembers.label: Select Group Members
selectGroupMembers.description: Select all members of the currently selected groups.

selectSolvers.label: Select Solvers
selectSolvers.summary: Select all solvers in the scene.
selectSolvers.description: Select all solvers in the scene.

createLollipop.label: Create Lollipop
createLollipop.summary: Create a new lollipop for the selected marker.
createLollipop.description: This creates a new lollipop for the marker such that it becomes easier to find in the viewport and Channel Box.

cacheSolver.label: Cache Solver
cacheSolver.summary: Cache the entire simulation of a solver
cacheSolver.description: This enables caching on all solvers, and runs through the current time to cache all of it.

uncacheSolver.label: Uncache Solver
uncacheSolver.summary: Remove the cache for a solver
uncacheSolver.description: This disables and clears the cache on a solver.

snapToSim.label: Snap to Sim
snapToSim.description: Translate and rotate marked controls to wherever the simulation is at the moment. Useful for partially recording only the current pose.

linkSolver.label: Link Solver
linkSolver.summary: Simulate two or more solvers as one.
linkSolver.description: Make markers from one solver participate in the simulation of another, such that they can interact. Useful for e.g. referencing two or more characters with their own solvers into one Maya scene, and still have them collide and be constrained to each other.

unlinkSolver.label: Unlink Solver
unlinkSolver.description: Restore an independent behavior of a linked solver.

useSelectedAsSource.label: Use Selected as Source
useSelectedAsSource.summary: Emit forces the using selected Marker.
useSelectedAsSource.description: Connect the output position of a marker for use as origin of the force(s) emitted by the selected field.

disconnectSource.label: Disconnect Source
disconnectSource.summary: Stop using a marker as source of the selected field.
disconnectSource.description: Disonnect the output position of a marker for use as origin of the force(s) emitted by the selected field.

comCentroid.label: Center of Mass Centroid
comCentroid.summary: Apply forces to the exact center of mass.
comCentroid.description: Forces applied to the center does not introduce any rotation and can be thought of as a simple, but unrealistic method.

volumetricCentroids.label: Volumetric Centroid
volumetricCentroids.summary: Apply forces throughout the volume of a Marker.
volumetricCentroids.description: Forces are applied evenly distributed across the Marker volume, resulting in the most natural and realistic result.

loggingDebug.label: More Logging
loggingDebug.summary: Print all messages you can think of.

loggingInfo.label: Default Logging
loggingInfo.summary: Print only messages that may be interesting, but probably aren't.

loggingWarning.label: Less Logging
loggingWarning.summary: Don't print anything unless it's something I need to pay attention to.
